meanings.definition: Decoyers (noun): People who lure or entice others into a trap or deception.
meanings.sent1: The decoyers set up a fake prize to trick people.
meanings.sent2: The decoyers led the unsuspecting travelers into a dangerous alley.
meanings.sent3: The decoyers pretended to be lost to attract help, but they were actually thieves.
meanings.sent4: The decoyers were like spiders spinning webs to catch their prey.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the decoyers who promise easy money but have hidden intentions.

meanings.definition: Decoyers (verb): To lure or entice someone into a trap or deception.
meanings.sent1: She decoyers her friends into playing pranks on others.
meanings.sent2: The scammer decoyers innocent people with false promises.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat decoyers the dog into chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: His smooth words decoyers many into believing his lies.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights decoyers moths, leading them away from safety.
